original_title: Remote Code Execution on an Oscilloscope
original_content:
There are a huge number of products available in the modern world that come with network connectivity now, when perhaps they might be better off with out it. Kitchen appliances like refrigerators are the classic example, but things like lightbulbs, toys, thermostats, and door locks can all be found with some sort of Internet connectivity. Perhaps for the worse, too, if the security of these devices isnt taken seriously, as they can all be vectors for attacks. Even things like this Rigol oscilloscope and its companion web app can be targets.
The vulnerability for this oscilloscope starts with an analysis of the firmware, which includes the web control application. To prevent potentially bricking a real oscilloscope, this firmware was emulated using QEMU. The vulnerability exists in the part of the code which involves changing the password, where an attacker can bypass authentication by injecting commands into the password fields. In the end, the only thing that needs to be done to gain arbitrary code execution on the oscilloscope is to issue a curl command directed at the oscilloscope.
In the end, [Maunel] suggests not connecting this oscilloscope to the Internet at all. He has informed the producer about it but as of this writing there has not been a resolution. It does, however, demonstrate the vulnerabilities that can be present in network-connected devices where the developers of the software havent gone to the lengths required to properly secure them for use with the modern Internet. Even things not connected to a traditional Internet connection can be targets for attacks.
title: インターネット接続の脆弱性を持つ電子機器の注意点と対策法
body:
インターネットに接続されたデバイスの脆弱性について警鐘。特にパスワード変更に関するコードの一部に重大な脆弱性があり、不正なコマンドを注入することで認証をバイパスできる。オシロスコープに任意のコードを実行するには、オシロスコープに対してcurlコマンドを発行するだけで良い。
このオシロスコープは、インターネットに接続しないことを推奨しており、製造元にも報告済み。近代のインターネットでの安全性を考慮していない、ネットワーク接続されたデバイスには潜在的な脆弱性があることを示している。
